page.title: 01Coalville Introduction...
page.content: { Coalville}was born as an industrial town 150 years ago on the site of Long Lane. It originally started as a railway station on the Leicester to Swannington Railway and developed through it being a transport centre for the coalmining, brickmaking, engineering and quarrying industries in the area. In the last five years{Coalville}has changed more than ever before. The pit at Snibstone closed in 1984. There is no longer any brickmaking and very little engineering industry left. Only the quarry for sand extraction is still working fully. In the centre of{Coalville}stands the{Clock Tower.}This is situated in Memorial Square in remembrance of the soldiers who died in the Two World Wars.
